summary: This is an FBI travel authorization request dated March 12, 2011, seeking approval for two Miami agents to travel internationally from March 14-21, 2011, to interview a U.S. citizen victim/witness in the Jeffrey Epstein child prostitution investigation. The document provides a synopsis of the case, details allegations against Epstein, and mentions the involvement of other individuals in recruiting victims and facilitating abuse.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the FBI investigation for procuring underage girls for massages and sexual acts at his Palm Beach residence and other locations. He is accused of instructing victims to have sex with his associates.

persons.name: Sarah Kellen
persons.context: Described in the document as Epstein's personal assistant who was involved in locating additional females to provide massages and who traveled with Epstein frequently.

connections.description: Kellen is described as Epstein's personal assistant who located additional females for massages and traveled with him frequently.
The document implies Kellen assisted Epstein in his scheme by recruiting females for massages, suggesting a collaborative role in the alleged criminal activity.

events.title: Initiation of FBI Investigation
events.description: The FBI investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for child prostitution was initiated after a request from the Palm Beach Police Department, who had an ongoing investigation.

events.title: Victim Notification by LEGAT
events.description: A victim/witness was served a letter by an FBI Legal Attach√© (LEGAT) notifying her she was a victim of a crime.

events.title: Victim Contacted U.S. Attorney's Office
events.description: A victim/witness contacted the U.S. Attorney's Office in West Palm Beach, expressing willingness to speak further about her activities with Epstein, including being instructed to have sex with his associates.

events.title: Planned FBI Agent Travel for Interview
events.description: Two Miami FBI agents were scheduled to travel internationally to conduct a face-to-face interview with a key victim/witness who lived outside the United States.

locations: Royal Palm Beach, Florida (apartment complex where Epstein paid for an apartment)
Various locations outside Florida (where Epstein traveled with victims)
keyFacts: The FBI investigation into Jeffrey Epstein for child prostitution began in July 2006 at the request of the Palm Beach Police Department.
Victims were typically recruited from local high schools by other underage females and paid $200-$1000 for massages and sexual acts at Epstein's residence.
A key victim/witness alleged that Epstein instructed her to have sex with numerous associates both in the U.S. and overseas, and she could identify other underage victims.
Epstein paid for an apartment in Royal Palm Beach for one victim and paid for another to attend a massage school abroad at age 20.
The document is a travel request for FBI agents to interview a victim/witness overseas in March 2011, indicating the investigation was still active at that time.
